result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:55 AM Defendant Charles A Reed in court.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Charles A Reed.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. 
BTC: Warrant vacated, bond reinstated.
Defendant missed court due to him being in hospital as he had a stroke.
State believes these cases will be resolved.  Defense agrees and wishes to remove jury trials from calendar.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Warrant is being forwarded to RCSO/Dispatch for entry
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on November 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

11:42 AM Defendant Charles A Reed not in court.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Charles A Reed.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defendant does not appear. Defense does not why he does not appear on this date.
Cases 21CF647 and 21CF1583 are both on today for final pretrial.  21CF647 is first for trial with 21CF1583 as the back up case for trial.
BTC: Bench warrant and bond forfeiture authorized.  JT to remain on calendar.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Transcript of Preliminary Hearing held 05-04-2022

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim M.B. (person, property, residence or family). Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

*AMENDED 05/18/22* DEFENDANT MAY BE REMOVED FROM GPS MONITORING.

9:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles A Reed in court.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Charles A Reed. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense has filed a bond motion, requesting a GPS exception for employment and childcare.
BTC: Motion to modify bond granted, defendant may be removed from GPS monitoring. Defendant still cannot have ANY contact with victim. 
NG plea entered.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defense.
by DA to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence.

9:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles A Reed in court.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl in court for Charles A Reed. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State asks court take Judicial notice of bond conditions held at the time of the alleged offense.
Court takes Judicial Notice.
State calls Deputy Paralta, DSAT
Direct by the State.
Defense on cross.
Parties rest.
State moves for bind over.
Defense Objects to bind over.
BTC: Probable cause found. bound over on all charges.
Arraignment scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
